headline: Devs behind ‘truly decentralised’ protocols won’t face DoJ prosecution, official says
summary: A Department of Justice official said the agency would not approve certain criminal charges against crypto devs. The announcement comes just weeks after a jury found a developer guilty of conspiracy to operate an unlicensed money-transmitting business.

headline: Strong market debuts raise questions over cautious IPO pricing by Wall St banks
summary: (Reuters) -Big first-day gains by recent high-profile U.S. listings have raised questions over whether Wall Street banks — wary of volatility and economic uncertainty from sweeping U.S. tariffs — are pricing them too cautiously, benefiting investors but causing issuers to miss out.  This route was taken by streaming platform Spotify and crypto exchange Coinbase in recent years.

headline: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong Forecasts A Million-Dollar Bitcoin By 2030 Amid 'Emerging' Regulatory Clarity In US
summary: Brian Armstrong, CEO of Coinbase Global Inc. (NASDAQ:COIN), predicted Wednesday that Bitcoin (CRYPTO: BTC) could hit $1 million by 2030, citing growing regulatory clarity in the U.S. Why Armstrong Thinks BTC Will Hit $1 Million During an interview with Stripe co-founder John Collison, Armstrong was asked about Bitcoin’s 10-year growth projection. “The rough idea I have in my head is, we’ll see a million-dollar Bitcoin by 2030, and there’s high error bars around these things,” he responded. headline: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong Predicts $1M Bitcoin by 2030
summary: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong predicts Bitcoin could hit $1 million by 2030, citing clearer U.S. regulations, growing institutional demand, and shrinking technical risks as key drivers.
